CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 14, 1962, pg. 24, reads: "New Faces With Pirates - These are some of the new faces found among the 1962 Pittsburgh Pirates...  In the second scene, the all-time greatest southpaw, Bob Grove, palms the ball as he chats with Bob Veale, a rookie lefty whose explosive serves remind old-timers of the great Grove of 30 years ago...  No rookie figured in Tuesday's opening day, 6-0 scuttling of the Phillies, but Veale was named to start the second game.  Only very impressive rookies get early calls of that sort,"Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 25, 1966, pg. 13A, reads: "Surprise! Veale Toughest, Through 1965 - Bob Veale listens to Bob Grove... ex-Athletes ace explains how he won 31, lost 4, in '31."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player Bob Veale listening to Bob "Lefty" Grove, at Forbes Field
